item.title: security: Inside RedVDS: How a single virtual desktop provider fueled worldwide cybercriminal operations
item.description:
Microsoft investigated RedVDS, a virtual desktop provider whose services were purchased by a global network of disparate cybercriminals to target multiple sectors. Working with law enforcement worldwide, Microsoft’s Digital Crimes Unit helped disrupt RedVDS infrastructure and related operations, a disruption detailed in a Microsoft Security Blog post.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent now supports self-hosted runners
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot coding agents can now run their development environment on self-hosted GitHub Actions runners managed by Actions Runner Controller (ARC), enabling teams to host agent workloads in their own infrastructure.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub MCP Server now supports GitHub Projects and more
item.description:
The GitHub MCP Server adds native support for GitHub Projects via a new management tool and deploys multiple strategies to reduce the server’s footprint, alongside other improvements noted in the changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: New Health Check infrastructure for Azure Traffic Manager
item.description:
Azure Traffic Manager’s new health check infrastructure is now generally available. The update improves the service’s resiliency and scalability, and Microsoft is migrating customers to the new probing infrastructure as the rollout progresses.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: GraphQL API resource limits
item.description:
GitHub is introducing new resource consumption limits to its GraphQL API to maintain infrastructure stability and dependability.

  • Source: GitHub

item.description:
